statements.original: Alaska has the most active volcanoes of any state in the United States.

explanation: Alaska has 141 potentially active volcanoes.

statements.original: The letter "T" is the most common in the English Language.

explanation: it's the letter "E".

statements.original: The blue whale is the biggest animal to have ever lived.

explanation: and that includes dinosaurs!

statements.original: A potato was the first vegetable to be planted on the space shuttle.

explanation: the University of Wisconsin-Madison and NASA partnered to put spuds in space.

statements.original: Football players started wearing helmets in 1943.

explanation: the first helmets were made of moleskin.

statements.original: Henry VIII had eight wives.

explanation: he had six and had two of them executed.

statements.original: New York City is composed of between 36 and 42 islands.

explanation: New York has three main islands: Manhattan Island, Staten Island and part of Long Island, and it also has a number of smaller islands within each borough.

statements.original: Polo takes up the largest amount of space in terms of land area.

explanation: this "Sport of Kings" is played on a 300-yard by 160-yard field.

statements.original: Pineapples grow on trees.

explanation: they actually grow in the ground.

statements.original: The letter "J" is the only letter in the alphabet not included in the periodic table.

explanation: and no element name starts with "Q".

statements.original: Cheesecake comes from Italy.

explanation: you can thank Greece for the tasty treat.

statements.original: Fortune cookies were invented in China.

explanation: they were invented in the United States.

statements.original: There are 30 NFL teams.

explanation: there are 32 teams divided into two conferences, the American Football Conference and National Football Conference.

statements.original: The goat is the national animal of Scotland.

explanation: it is the unicorn.

statements.original: It takes a sloth two weeks to digest a meal.

explanation: that's the slowest digestion time of any mammal!

statements.original: The human body has four lungs.

explanation: it has two. Those lungs aid the average person in breathing 11,000 liters of air every day.

statements.original: The two longest rivers in the world are the Mississippi and the Nile.

explanation: it is the Nile and the Amazon.

statements.original: Greenland is the largest island in the world.

explanation: the island is approximately 836,330 square miles - three times the size of Texas.

statements.original: Humans lose an average of 75 strands of hair a month.

explanation: humans can lose up to 75 strands in ONE DAY.

statements.original: The largest living frog is the Goliath frog of West Africa.

explanation: this amphibian reaches lengths of 12.5 inches and weighs 7.2 pounds.

statements.original: The song "We Don't Talk About Bruno" from Encanto is the first Disney song to hit #1 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart in 29 years.

explanation: Disney's last number one hit was "A Whole New World" from Aladdin in 1993. (Frozen hit "Let It Go" peaked at #5)

statements.original: Vanilla is the world's most expensive spice.

explanation: saffron is the most expensive spice. A kilogram requires the stigmas of about 150,000 flowers.

statements.original: The hummingbird egg is the world's smallest bird egg.

explanation: on the flip side, ostriches lay the largest eggs.

statements.original: There are seven nights in Kwanzaa.

explanation: each night a candle is lit to observe the Ngubo Saba, the seven principles of Kwanzaa.

statements.original: Pinocchio was the first animated, full-color Walt Disney feature film.

explanation: it was Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs.

statements.original: Dumbo is the shortest Disney film.

explanation: this feature-length film runs only 64 minutes long.

statements.original: A dog sweats by panting its tongue.

explanation: canines sweat through glands in their paws.

statements.original: Dr. Pepper is the oldest soft drink in America.

explanation: it was first sold in 1885 in a drug store in Waco, Texas.

statements.original: The Tour de France always finishes in Italy.

explanation: the finish line is on the Champs-élysées, one of the most famous streets in Paris.

statements.original: Brazil is the only nation to have played in every World Cup finals tournament.

explanation: the soccer-crazed country has also won the most titles.

statements.original: Ears of corn have an even number of rows.

explanation: an average ear has 16 rows of kernels.

statements.original: Three strikes in a row in bowling is called a chicken.

explanation: it is called a turkey.

statements.original: Pepsi was the first soft drink to be enjoyed in outer space.

explanation: Coca-Cola first quenched the thirst of the astronauts.

statements.original: Only two men signed the Declaration of Independence on July 4, 1776.

explanation: Charles Thompson and John Hancock signed the Declaration of Independence on July 4, 1776. Over the course of the next month, the other 54 delegates signed the historic document.

statements.original: Beauty and the Beast was Disney's first Broadway musical.

explanation: Beauty and the Beast premiered on Broadway in 1994 and ran for 13 years.

statements.original: China has the longest coastline in the world.

explanation: the winner is Canada with 151,019 miles.

statements.original: The Atlantic Ocean is the biggest ocean on Earth.

explanation: the Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean covering more than 60 million square miles.

statements.original: Hawaiian pizza comes from Canada.

explanation: it was created in 1962 by Sam Panopoulos at the Satellite Restaurant in Ontario, Canada.

statements.original: Mcdonald's has the most restaurants by location in the United States.

explanation: Subway takes the prize with locations in 49 out 50 states.

statements.original: Every golf ball has the same number of dimples.

explanation: golf balls have between 300 to 500 dimples.

statements.original: Sea otters have a favorite rock they use to break open food.

explanation: they keep these treasures in the loose skin under their arms.

statements.original: The names of the mascots for Rice Krispies are Snap, Crackle, & Pop.

explanation: the elf-like creatures first appear in the 1930s.

statements.original: Aladdin's character was based on Brad Pitt.

explanation: Tom Cruise was the inspiration for the character.

statements.original: The most common blood type is 0- negative.

explanation: and AB- negative is the rarest.

statements.original: Pigs roll in the mud because they don't like being clean.

explanation: pigs have few sweat glands and their muddy baths help keep them cool.

statements.original: A monkey was the first non-human to go into space.

explanation: fruit flies were the first to make the trip.

statements.original: South Africa has one capital.

explanation: it has three: Pretoria, Cape Town, and Bloemfontein.

statements.original: The human body is about 60% water.

explanation: water is essential for every cell to function.

statements.original: The human eye can distinguish 10 million different colors.

explanation: the average human eye contains three cones sensitive to red, green, and blue wavelengths of light.

statements.original: Bats are blind.

explanation: bats often find their way using ultrasound but their eyes work, just not particularly well).

statements.original: The name of Batman's butler is Albert.

explanation: the butler's name is Alfred.

statements.original: Caesar Salad originates from Italy.

explanation: the delicious leafy goodness was a product of Tijuana, Mexico.

statements.original: Sharks are mammals.

explanation: they are actually classified as fish.

statements.original: Infants have more bones than adults.

explanation: infants are born with approximately 300 bones but have 206 by the time they reach adulthood.

statements.original: Vatican City is the smallest country in the world.

explanation: measuring a mere 0.2 square miles, it is almost 120 times smaller than Manhattan in New York.

statements.original: Prince Eric and Ariel from The Little Mermaid have a daughter named Princess Song.

explanation: her name is Princess Melody, she is the main character in The Little Mermaid II: Return to the Sea.

statements.original: Galapagos tortoises sleep up to 16 hours a day.

explanation: and they can go a year without food or water, so they have lots of time for extra sleep.

statements.original: The heart is the largest internal organ in the body.

explanation: the largest internal organ in the body is the liver (the skin is the largest overall).

statements.original: The Chunnel between England and France is 31.5 miles long.

explanation: it is the world's longest undersea tunnel - that's the equivalent of 169 Eiffel Towers stacked on top of each other.

statements.original: Pepperoni is the most popular pizza topping in the US.

explanation: mushrooms come in second.

statements.original: When exiting a cave, bats always go in the direction of the wind.

explanation: bats always turn left out of a cave.

statements.original: Human skin regenerates every week.

explanation: it regenerates every 28 days with an average of 0.001 - 0.003 ounces of skin flakes every hour).

statements.original: The first St. Patrick's Day parade in the United States was held in New York City.

explanation: Boston hosted the first St. Patty's Day parade in the U.S. in 1737.

statements.original: French fries originated from France.

explanation: we have Belgium to thank for the crispy fried goodness.

statements.original: The New York Marathon is the largest in the world.

explanation: this popular race had humble beginnings with only 127 runners when it started in 1970.

statements.original: Marvel published its first comic in October 1939.

explanation: if you can get your hands on a copy, you could sell it for up to $1 million.

statements.original: The average human sneeze can be clocked at 100 miles an hour.

explanation: and be sure to cover your nose, a sneeze can create upwards of 100,000 droplets.

statements.original: President George Washington brought macaroni and cheese to the USA.

explanation: President Thomas Jefferson gets the credit. He brought the recipe back from Paris, France.

statements.original: Herbivores are animal eaters.

explanation: herbivores only eat plants.

statements.original: All the kings in a standard deck of cards have a mustache.

explanation: the King of Hearts does not have a mustache.

statements.original: Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world.

explanation: Mount Everest reaches an elevation of 29,032 feet.

statements.original: Venezuela is home to the world's highest waterfall.

explanation: you would have to climb 979 meters to reach the top.

statements.original: The Aristocats was the first film to be made after Walt Disney's death.

explanation: it was the last film to be approved by Walt Disney directly and the last to end with the line "A Walt Disney Production."

statements.original: The Harry Potter film, Chamber of Secrets, is the longest film of the Harry Potter movies.

explanation: set aside 161 minutes to watch this movie!

statements.original: The official color of the Golden Gate Bridge in California is "Tennessee Orange."

explanation: the color is known as "International Orange" and provides visibility to ships coming into the bay.

statements.original: The U.S. and Canada celebrate Thanksgiving on the same day.

explanation: the U.S. celebrates Thanksgiving on the fourth Thursday of November and Canada celebrates the holiday on the second Monday of October.

statements.original: You can find the 'Desert of Death' in California.

explanation: you will have to travel to Dasht-e Margo, Afghanistan to find it.

statements.original: The maximum length for a video posted on TikTok is 45 seconds.

explanation: it is 60 seconds.

statements.original: Memorial Day has a special set of instructions regarding raising and lowering the U.S. flag.

explanation: flags should be flown at half-staff from dawn till noon to honor those who have fallen in the line of duty. At noon, flags should be flown at full-staff to honor all those who have served.

statements.original: World-renowned jeweler Tiffany & Co. is the maker of the Vince Lombardi trophy.

explanation: Tiffany has produced the trophy since the first Super Bowl in 1967.
